meanings.definition: A person who mistakenly uses a word in place of a similar-sounding one, often with unintentionally humorous effect.
meanings.sent1: The malapropists in the play made everyone laugh with their mix-ups.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained that malapropists often create funny situations by using the wrong words.
meanings.sent3: The malapropists at the comedy show had the audience in stitches with their language blunders.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the malapropist queen, turning every conversation into a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent5: The image of the malapropists mixing up words stuck in my mind, making me chuckle.
